Image 64: X;) Email This Story [...] NASA's Space Launch System rocket and Orion capsule are already at Kennedy Space Center's Launch Complex 39B, positioned for what the agency calls a major step toward putting people back on the lunar surface with Artemis 3 as early as next year. The five potential launch dates next month are Feb. 6-8 and Feb. 10-11, per Space.com. If those don't work out, NASA is looking at five potential launch dates in March and six in April.

# Saban Films Takes U.S. For Houston Bone’s Horror ‘Son of Sara: Volume 1’

EXCLUSIVE: Saban Films has acquired U.S. rights for Canadian director Houston Bone’s horror Son of Sara: Volume 1 about a troubled pregnant woman who accepts an invite to a dinner party which degenerates into a bloody and demented nightmare.

New York-based Visit Films sealed the deal and will be continuing sales on the title at European Film Market next month.

# Mediawan Confirms Acquisition Of Peter Chernin’s North Road

French giant Mediawan, which already owns Plan B, has confirmed it is to acquire Peter Chernin’s North Road.

Financial terms of the deal were not disclosed but the pair said they are creating a 100-production company size unit representing more than $2B in annual production volume across 15 countries.

# Richard Linklater’s ‘Nouvelle Vague’ Leads Nominations For France’s César Awards As Ceremony Date Change Announced

Richard Linklater’s Nouvelle Vague has topped the nominations for the 51st edition of France’s César awards.

Linklater’s ode to the French new wave Nouvelle Vague was nominated in 10 categories, including for Best Director and Best Film. [...] More to follow…

## Site [...] The nominations were unveiled Patrick Sobelman and Ariane Toscan du Plantier, presidents of the  Academy of Cinema Arts and Techniques, or César Academy, in Paris on Wednesday.

Just prior to revealing the nominations, the academy also announced it was moving the previously ceremony’s previously date to avoid clashing with a major televised charity event.

The awards will now take place on February 26, instead of February 27, at the l’Olympia concert hall in Paris, presided over by Camille Cottin and presented Benjamin Lavernhe with support from a variety of French cinema artists.

### Watch on Deadline

Jim Carrey will receive the honorary César this year.
